In the Bag

It’s 2:04am MST and I just bought my wife the iPhone 6. She is contentedly sleeping away, of course; I told her earlier this evening that I wasn’t sure I could do it, but that I would give it a shot. That was a semi-fib; I was fairly confident all along that I could do it.1

Link Mash (September 11, 2014)

The weekly Link Mash is a curated selection of tools, stories, and other links that I found during my travels on the web. All of my links can be found on my Pinboard; you can also find the Link Mash archives here.

Sep 8, 2014

WordPress, GitHub Gists, and RSS Feeds

The other day, I was looking at one of my posts in an RSS reader and noticed something interesting: it was missing all of its code snippets. Given that the post in question was code-related, missing snippets was a bad thing.

Sep 8, 2014 • ∞

→ Amazon Fire Phone Flickers Out, Now Sells For 99 Cents

Adrianna Lee with Readwrite:

A month and a half after it released, the company has discounted the price of the handset to 99 cents on contract. That’s a big discount—99.5%, to be exact—from the $199 price tag when Amazon announced the phone in June, just three months ago.

I love my iPhone. Before it, I loved my two Android devices. But to be completely honest, I was hoping that Apple and Google would receive some serious competition from Amazon. So much for that.
